titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I attended Mattins: worked at the Lecture: wrote many letters: walked with Jim in sleet & snow. Voila tout!
I drafted a resolution about the Archbishops' Report on Church & State, and sent it to Welldon, asking him to second it at the meeting of the Northern Convocation at York on the 8
Blackett, with their married daughter, M

Bradford, came to dinner. We had a vivacious discussion of the economic question. The good Colonel has formed very decided opinions of his own, & he has a large knowledge of mining, but his acquaintance with other subjects is, perhaps, not so large.
